Key Match Events: The Warriors led by 18, but Malik Beasley missed a 3-pointer just before the buzzer that could have sent the game to overtime.
Draymond Green had words with Ron Holland, dunked, drew a charge against the rookie and set up Hield for a 3-pointer to put the Warriors ahead 92-78 midway through the fourth quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: Warriors coach Steve Kerr, whose 90-year-old mother lost her home in the California wildfires, said his team lacked “a competitive spirit” earlier this week and was certainly happy with the response in Detroit.
Post-Match Reflections: Warriors coach Steve Kerr was happy with the response in Detroit after his team lacked “a competitive spirit” earlier this week.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Golden State earned a much-needed victory after dropping two straight games at home, losing by 16 points to Miami and getting routed by 30 points against Sacramento.
The Pistons fell to.500 after winning five straight and eight of their previous nine games.
Others: Cade Cunningham had 32 points, eight assists and six rebounds for the Pistons.
Tobias Harris had 13 points and Ron Holland scored 11 for the Pistons.
Trayce Jackson-Davis had 14 points and 10 rebounds for the Warriors.
Dennis Schroder and Gui Santos each had 13 points for the Warriors.
Lindy Waters added 11 points for the Warriors.
